issue.title: Bump libfmt

repository.name: DevilutionX
repository.description: Diablo build for modern operating systems

issue.body:
Hopefully we'll be able to get rid of the custom nxdk fork soon.

Disabling `FMT_OS` is the first step towards that. I've also asked the fmt author about handling Windows-like platforms without Unicode support in https://github.com/fmtlib/fmt/issues/3631.

The 3ds build was initially failing due to the 3ds SDK defining a macro (`PACKED`) with the same name as an fmt template argument. Now fixed (worked around). https://github.com/fmtlib/fmt/issues/3632.

body: Windows 98 has been discontinued many years ago. Why should we care about supporting it? Is it for some kind of a retro computing project?

It'd be cool to have DevilutionX run on the original platform it launched on.
This is of course just for fun, it's not meant to be useful.

issue.title: Add an option to avoid wchar APIs on Windows
issue.body:
With this, fmt can be used on Windows 98 and the Original Xbox with:

```cmake
set(FMT_OS OFF)
target_compile_definitions(fmt PUBLIC FMT_WINDOWS_NO_WCHAR)
```

Fixes #3631

body: I've sent a PR in #3636. The change is tiny and it eliminates the need for us to maintain our own libfmt fork.
